According to Bravo, Giudice said she was willing to put the past behind her after meeting with her brother at their late parents' grave.
“I talked to my brother, first — because I thought that was only right — he was like, really happy to see me. I was happy to see him," she said.
“At first, he didn’t want to meet there. He said, ‘That’s weird.’ I’m like, ‘No, it’s not weird.’ Because I didn’t want anybody to take photos of us or anything like that,” she shared.
Giudice explained that she found the area "peaceful" and thought it was a place where Joe Gorga could keep his cool. Giudice said her brother had "tears in his eyes" during their conversation.
Now, she said that they're in a "good place" and she would like her kids to hang out with Joe and Melissa Gorga.

“I want him in my life, I want his wife in my life, my sister-in-law, my niece and nephews in my life,” she added. “Like, that’s the most important thing. Like, I want the kids to hang out. But when it’s toxic between the parents, the kids don’t want to hang out.”

Melissa Gorga also alluded to their reconciliation in a Nov. 15 Instagram post. The fellow "Real Housewives of New Jersey" star shared a picture of her, Joe Gorga, Giudice and Giudice's husband, Luis Ruelas, posing for a picture together at BravoCon.
She captioned the snap, "Don’t question it - Just support it #family."

title: New TikTok Trend Has People Posting Their Family Members' Wildest Texts
summary: A new trend has been going viral on TikTok where social media users are sharing the funny text messages that they get from their family members.
story: TikTokers are putting their family members on blast.
On social media, users are sharing the kinds of text messages they receive from family members that you simply have to "read and move on."
The trend consists of creators sharing screenshots of funny texts from parents, siblings and more. The messages range from moms' overly concerned messages to dads' out of pocket jokes.
One video that's amassed more than 700,000 likes is from creator Audrey Saxton of Dallas, Texas. The 27-year-old shared a screenshot of a funny conversation she had with her father.

At the beginning of the message, Saxton's dad reminded her to wish her mother a "happy mom day." But when she asked if there are any pictures from when she was a baby, her father responded with a surprising question.
"Who is this," he replied.
“Sometimes you have to read your dads text and move on,” she wrote over a screenshot of the message.
Saxton tells TODAY.com that she responded to her dad's message with "15 question marks." And in true dad joke fashion, he replied he was "just kidding."
"Our texts messages never make any sense. They are always shorthanded or someone’s responding days later and I knew that we would have something funny," she says.
In another viral video, 25-year-old Ohio native Rania Saleh shared a series of text messages with her niece.
In the screenshot, Saleh's 16-year-old niece, Riyah, told her she misses her. After Saleh responded, "I actually miss you more," her niece explained why she started thinking of her.
"I thought about you today bc in ap psych we learned about how peoples mental and physical health starts to decline in their mid twenties," the 16-year-old wrote.
Like viewers, Saleh tells TODAY.com she burst out laughing once she read the message.

"I gasped and just died laughing!" she says. "I was like, wow, I guess I really am entering my mid-20s but I’m going to prove her psych teacher wrong! I’m happy she thought of me but I was just shocked that that’s what reminded her to text me and check in!"

"Although it was super funny, it was also really sweet of her," she adds. "I remember sending the text to all of my siblings, including her mom and they were all like 'Yup! That sounds like something Riyah would send.' It made everyone’s day."
The "read and move on" trend has resonated with social users because of its relatability.
Oluwaseye Oyelowo, a 25-year-old from Atlanta, Georgia, agrees. When she heard about the trend, she decided to get in on the fun by roasting her 22-year-old sister, Oluwasayo.
"I felt like people should see the funny relationship that I have with my younger sister and how comfortable she is with me," she tells TODAY.com.
In her post, Oluwasayo out of the blue asked her older sister, "When do you get paid and how much can I get?"
Oyelowo says with a laugh that the message is true to form for her sister.

"Growing up it was mainly my mom providing for us and now that I’m working, I always make it be known that they can ask for anything, just to help remove a load off our mother. So yes, that is the normal for us," she says. “She’s very forward with her requests and I just chuckle because I know her and read her message in her voice."
So much so that sometimes, "you have to look at your sister's text message and move on with your day," as Oyelowo captioned the video.
Oyelowo also received a fitting reaction from her sister once she told her their messages went viral.
"I called my sister and said ‘You’re famous,’” Oyelowo says with a laugh. "And she said she’s putting interest on the money she wanted me to give for using her."

title: 'All Her Fault' Author Recalls the Real-Life Moment That Inspired Her Book
summary: All Her Fault author Andrea Mara speaks out about the real inspiration behind the show All Her Fault.
story: When “All Her Fault” author Andrea Mara’s middle daughter was 5 years old, she went to pick her up for a playdate. She drove to the address listed on the school directory and rang the doorbell. No answer. She rang again. Still not an answer.
Then, she peered inside the window — and her heart stopped.

“There was no furniture in the house. Nobody lived in the house. My heart nearly jumped out of my chest with fright, and I immediately thought, ‘Oh, my God, my child has been kidnapped,’” Mara tells TODAY.com.
Mara feared it was a fake playdate and her child had been taken. “I think lots of parents can probably relate to that, that your mind goes to the worst case scenario,” she says.
Then, a neighbor popped her head out to reveal the owners had moved just weeks prior, so the printed out school directory wasn’t up-to-date.
Mara was able to pick her daughter up from the correct address, but the scenario never left her. When she was looking to write her fourth novel, she returned to the concept.
“I thought, ‘OK, I think I want to write that playdate book,’” she says.

That “playdate book” became “All Her Fault,” published in 2021 and adapted into a Peacock drama released earlier this month, starring actor Sarah Snook. In the book and series, Marissa and Peter Irvine's lives are thrown into turmoil when their young son Milo goes missing during a playdate. It turns out he's been kidnapped, just as Mara feared in her own imagination.

Beyond the unguessable twists, “All Her Fault” is starting conversations about division of labor and why women bear the brunt of the responsibility for day-to-day life and are blamed when it goes awry. The show’s main husbands, Peter (Jake Lacy) and Richie (Thomas Cocquerel), are on a spectrum of problematic, ranging from sociopathic to inept.

“(My husband) has been watching the show with me, and he’s kind of like, ‘Come on. Please say this isn’t based on me.’ And I said to him, ‘Look, you weren’t listening to me, so I had to write a book,’” she says, laughing.

While she says her husband is nothing like Richie, who leaves his wife to figure out all the details of their child’s life, she did often feel like the “default parent,” forced to do more of the problem-solving.
Mara, who describes herself as an “overthinker,” says she uses her novels as a way to work through scenarios.
“Writing books is therapy, so I get it all out of my system by writing the book and just pushing it on to other people,” she says.
She has a 28-page-long document with a running list of ideas for crime novels inspired by real-life scenarios.
Her next book, “It Should Have Been You,” out in 2026, imagines what might happen if someone sent a mean text about a neighbor to the neighborhood group text. Then, four people wind up dead.

“I have a big neighborhood Whatsapp group here, and they think it’s very funny that I made a whole book out of the messages they send in error in our group. Everyone’s like, ‘Oh, be careful. She’s probably reading these messages for her new book,’” she says.

title: Cynthia Erivo and Misty Copeland Duet Stripped-Down Rendition of ‘No Good Deed’ from ‘Wicked’
summary: Misty Copeland and Cynthia Erivo reunited for a live performance of "No Good Deed" ahead of the upcoming release of "Wicked: For Good."
story: Misty Copeland and Cynthia Erivo are back at it again.
The Tony winner and legendary ballerina reunited for a live performance of "No Good Deed," a song featured in "Wicked: For Good," in anticipation of the Nov. 21 release of the film.
In the clip, Copeland dances around Erivo as the Grammy-winning singer belts out a stripped-down version of the tune.
For the performance, Erivo donned a gorgeous green backless dress that paid homage to her "Wicked" character, Elphaba, and Copeland wore a flowing champagne-colored gown.
At the end of the video, which was shared on the official YouTube accounts of “Wicked: For Good” and Universal Pictures, the friends smiled and gave one another a hug.
Copeland and Erivo also shared the phenomenal video on their Instagram accounts, where they received rave reviews.
"You got these two masters of their craft in one room?! 😍" one person wrote.
"Obsessed," another said.
A third added, "This power couple i knew i always needed 🩰👏🏼🤍."

Ten years ago, the pair previously dueted in an "impromptu collaboration," which Copeland also shared on Instagram in 2024. In the video, she danced around a ballet studio in a flowing pink dress while Erivo accompanied her on vocals.
"An unforgettable moment with @cynthiaerivo! 🩰 Congratulations on your incredible #Wicked performance✨," Copeland penned the caption.
In October, Copeland retired from her role as a principal dancer at the American Ballet Theatre. Though she's no longer with the company, she still holds dance close to her heart.

In an interview with Harper’s Bazaar, Copeland said she plans to “continue performing in some capacity.” In a statement from the American Ballet Theatre, Copeland added that her retirement "isn't a farewell."
“I could never have imagined the life ballet would give me," Copeland said at the time.
"This moment isn’t a farewell, it’s a celebration of everything we’ve built together, and a step toward all the work that’s still ahead," she added.

title: Jessi Ngatikaura Gives an Update on Her Marriage After Rocky 'Mormon Wives' Season 3
summary: Are Jessi and Jordan Ngatikaura from The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives still together now?
story: Jessi Ngatikaura gives an update on the status of her marriage in the Season 3 finale of "The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives."
Ever since the Season 2 finale aired, fans of the Hulu series have been wondering whether the reality star was still married to her husband, Jordan Ngatikaura, amid ongoing rumors of infidelity.
Season 3 finds the couple undergoing a 90-day separation and sheds light on Jessi Ngatikaura's emotional affair with "Vanderpump Villa" star Marciano Brunette.
Did the Ngatikauras decide to stay together at the end of the season or are they headed for divorce? Here's a look back at their marital woes and an update on where their relationship stands.
Season 2 Ended with Rumors of Infidelity in Jessi's Marriage
While filming Season 2, the #MomTok ladies visited Lisa Vanderpump’s villa in Italy as guest stars in the show "Vanderpump Villa."

Rumors quickly spread that Demi Engemann had developed a connection with Marciano Brunette, one of the villa's staff members and a "Vanderpump Villa" star. Engemann, who is married, denied the rumors.

Brunette spoke with Taylor Frankie Paul at the end of Season 2 and said he actually was romantically involved with Jessi Ngatikaura, not Engemann. Jessi Ngatikaura alluded to the rumor in a preview of Season 3, saying, “He knows that this is ruining my family, my life.”
She also blamed Engemann, saying, “This is Demi’s doing.”
Jessi Admitted to an 'Emotional Affair' During Season 3

Viewers got some of the answers they'd been waiting for when Season 3 premiered on Nov. 13. Jessi Ngatikaura admitted that she had an emotional affair with Brunette after meeting him at Vanderpump's villa, but denied his claims that they had slept together.

While speaking with her co-star Layla Taylor, Jessi Ngatikaura opened up about the affair and revealed that she and her husband had separated briefly before she met Brunette. At the villa, she said she and Brunette kissed a few times.

The Ngatikauras agreed to speak candidly about their marital problems. In a confessional interview in Episode 1, Jessi Ngatikaura expressed remorse for her actions, saying, "I just feel so regretful and I’m so disappointed in myself."
Jordan Ngatikaura later said he felt "emotionally abandoned" by his wife after the affair.
Jessi and Jordan Embarked on a 90-Day Separation
Throughout Season 3, the Ngatikauras underwent a 90-day separation. While speaking with the other #MomTok ladies, Jessi Ngatikaura shared the text messages she'd exchanged with Brunette.

Later on in the season, Brunette admitted that he had lied about sleeping with Jessi Ngatikaura and claimed that Engemann pressured him to do so. She later denied his claims. Brunette also said he had kissed Engemann.
Brunette and Jessi Ngatikaura met in person to clear the air and took a lie detector test to prove that they weren't lying about not sleeping together.

While reviewing the results, Jessi Ngatikaura was pleased to see that her response was "true" when she said she hadn't slept with Brunette. Some of the other responses she gave were inconclusive, however.

For instance, when asked if she had any sexual contact with Brunette aside from their two kisses, she said no and the results said "inconclusive." When asked if she had lied about anything involving Brunette, Jessi Ngatikaura said no but the results said "significant reaction failed."
During a discussion with his wife, Jordan Ngatikaura said he was frustrated that she went out to eat with Brunette and her friends after the lie detector test.

While speaking with her co-stars later in the season, Jessi Ngatikaura said she and her husband had been struggling in their marriage for three years. She cited several behaviors from Jordan Ngatikaura, including “name calling, talking down to me, yelling” that had all contributed to their separation.
“I didn’t do anything right: parenting laundry, housework," she said.
What Jessi Told TODAY.com About Her Season 3 Journey

During a recent video call with TODAY.com, Jessi Ngatikaura said it's "always scary to put yourself out there" when you're addressing sensitive topics on camera. However, she and her husband were on the same page in that they wanted to be honest with viewers.

"When we started talking about it on camera, we both agreed that if we’re going to do this, we’re going to do it 100%. We’re going to own our s---. We’re going to talk about the mistakes we’ve made and take the audience along on the journey," she said.
The reality star said everyone has "been through ups and downs in a relationship" and can relate to her story in one way or other.
"So just showcasing that and showing that we’re in therapy, we’re working on things, and we’ll see where it goes," she said.
In the end, Jessi Ngatikaura said she wanted to showcase the highs and lows of her marriage to offer an authentic view of their relationship.

"Hopefully that can help someone, similar to what Jen and Zac (Affleck) did in Season 1 and 2. They kind of put it all out there and I think it’s strengthened their marriage over time. And I’m hoping it’ll do the same for us," she said.
Are Jessi and Jordan Still Together?

Towards the end of Season 3, Jessi Ngatikaura said she was feeling "hopeful" about the future of her marriage. In the season finale, the couple agreed to end their separation and give their relationship another try.

"I want to make it work with you — not out of necessity, but because that's what I want because I can't imagine my life without you. And I believe that we both deserve to put what's happened behind us and try to move forward from it," Jordan Ngatikaura told his wife.
Jessi Ngatikaura was happy to hear this reassurance from her husband but expressed her concerns.

"Throughout this whole separation, I've been in limbo of like really not knowing what I wanted and I'm still scared. My biggest fear is that we're going to move back in together and get back together and give it a chance and it's just going to go right back to how it was, and that's it's easy to just get comfortable and fall back into old patterns, you know? So I am really scared of that if I'm being honest," she said.
Jordan Ngatikaura said he felt like he's had the opportunity to address "traumas" from his past and avoid falling back into old habits.
"Before all of this, I didn't know why you would act certain ways or treat me certain ways. You didn't know why I would pull away and avoid things," Jessi Ngatikaura said.
She went on to explain that therapy taught her that her husband's "aggression" comes from childhood wounds and becoming a dad as a teenager.

"There's so much that I understand now about you. And not that it makes your behavior OK, but I understand it now and it's changing, which is the most important part," Jessi Ngatikaura said, adding that she's also made her own progress with being more emotionally available for her husband.
In a confessional interview, Jessi Ngatikaura opened up about what therapy has taught her about herself.

"I've seen how being avoidant has hurt my relationships. And in our culture, there is a lot of pressure to have the perfect relationship, the perfect family and everything's great. And I think that it kind of taught me these patterns to go numb and avoid and pretend everything's OK," she said.
"And if I'm going to make the marriage work, I need to drop that and I'm willing to do that because Jordan has made so many changes. And I want to make sure that I'm doing the same thing."

title: You’ll Never Believe How Many Bridesmaids Jenna Had at Her Wedding
summary: Jenna Bush revealed on TODAY with Jenna & Friends that she had 19 bridesmaids when she married Henry Hager in 2008.
story: Narrowing down a list of bridesmaids for your wedding can be challenging. Just ask Jenna Bush Hager.
While chatting with guest co-host Leslie Bibb about weddings on Nov. 14, Jenna admitted that she had quite a few friends stand up for her when she married Henry Hager in 2008.
"How many bridesmaids did you have in your wedding?" Bibb asked.
"Too many," Jenna replied.
"How many?" Bibb repeated and playfully raised her voice.
"Too many," Jenna repeated.
"How many is too many?" Bibb asked.
After explaining that she only asked twin sister Barbara Pierce Bush to stand at the altar with her, Jenna revealed that she had 19 bridesmaids in total.
Bibb's jaw dropped in shock. Other people in Studio 1A were equally surprised by Jenna's response.
"Don't judge! Look at everybody's faces. That's a room full of shame," Jenna said.
"That's not shame," Bibb began.
"That's disgust. I see disgust on your face," Jenna said, addressing the room.
Bibb still couldn't get over it and said "I don't think I've ever known anybody to have (that many bridesmaids)."
"Oh look at Ashley. Everybody's shaming me, Both Ashleys. OK, I know," Jenna said.
Bibb was curious to know if all of Jenna's bridesmaids wore the same thing. She said they wore "color coordinated" outfits.
"I let them pick their style. I'll let them do everything," Jenna said.
The mother of three shared she was just discussing bridesmaids dresses with her 12-year-old daughter Mila the other day.

"I have different sketches by fashion designers in my bathroom. Oscar de la Renta did my wedding dress, and he drew the sketch so I have that there. But I have my bridesmaids dresses with the fabrics. And Mila goes, 'You had them all wear those?' And I was like, 'Yeah.' And she's like, 'That's a choice,'" Jenna said.
Jenna, who celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary in May 2025, has shared several details from her big day over the years, including the Bible verses her grandparents read at the ceremony.
In 2021, Jenna also opened up about a sweet moment she shared with her father, George W. Bush, on the day.
“I think my dad picked me up in a pickup truck, in his pickup truck, and he said, ‘You look beautiful, baby,’ and then we both just wept,” she said on TODAY with Hoda & Jenna.

title: Quinn Daly, Carson’s Sister and Hallmark Superfan, Goes to Magical Premiere of ‘Bills Love Story’ Movie
summary: Carson Daly's sister, Quinn, covered the premiere of the upcoming Hallmark movie “Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story.”
story: Have yourself a very Daly Christmas.

Carson Daly’s sister, Quinn Daly, recently attended the premiere of the upcoming Hallmark movie “Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” as part of its “Countdown to Christmas.” The film centers on the NFL’s Buffalo Bills.
Quinn is a huge fan of Hallmark’s Christmas movies and was invited to attend the premiere in East Aurora, New York, a small town just outside of Buffalo where the movie was shot.
Quinn got ready first by shopping at Vidlers, a store in town seen in the film. After filling up on various items, she got ready for the premiere itself by getting her hair and makeup done.
“Oh my god, I look so good!” she said. “I feel like I’m 35!”
After putting on a sequined Bills jacket and Christmas hat, Quinn paused to explain just why she enjoys Hallmark Christmas movies so much.
“I love Hallmark movies because my mom loved Christmas. My mom was Christmas. And the first time I saw a Hallmark Christmas movie was in her house,” she said while getting a little emotional.

“So now when I watch a Hallmark Christmas movie, I really feel like my mom’s there. There’s always a happy ending. There’s always just like fun and joy in these movies. They just mean a lot. And so it’s just incredible to be here.”
Quinn then hitched a ride to the premiere with the cast of the film, which includes Matthew Daddario, Tracy Pollan, Steve Schirripa, Holland Roden, Caroline Aaron, Joe Pantoliano and Patti Murin.
“That was amazing,” she said.
In the film, Daddario and Roden play characters whose families love the Bills.
“It feels like one of those holiday yester-year movies,” Roden told Quinn. “It has a lot of nostalgia from like either the 1970s, 1990s, football mania.”
Murin is a veteran of the Hallmark movie circuit, who addressed the chatter that this film may have been inspired by Bills quarterback Josh Allen’s marriage to Hailee Steinfeld.
“Well, I know that he was getting married right when we were filming it,” she told Quinn. “So, that was really cool to be here while they were in their offseason, but doing some life things.”
Schirripa, who’s known for his work on “The Sopranos,” said Hallmark movies offer a nice alternative.
“You know what’s great about Hallmark? There’s no shooting, no killing, no arguing,” he told Quinn.
“Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” features cameos by a few Bills players, including Damar Hamlin, DeWayne Carter and Ray Davis.
Carter said he may do more acting down the line.
“I mean, of course. You know, a fun fact about me, I’m actually a theatre minor,” he said.
Davis, meanwhile, is in awe that he was part of the film.
“It was insane. It was crazy, just to be able to even say I’m even in a movie,” he said.
Quinn then participated in Hallmark’s festive “Peppermint Procession” from the red carpet to the movie theater, with fans cheering “Let’s go Buffalo!” along the way, while snow fell from the sky.
“This night just keeps getting better! It’s like the end of a Hallmark movie when it suddenly starts to snow,” she said.
“Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” premieres Nov. 22 at 8 p.m. ET. It will stream the next day on Hallmark+.

title: Cardi B Gives Birth to Baby No. 4, First With Boyfriend Stefon Diggs
summary: Cardi B has welcomed her fourth child, and her first with boyfriend and NFL star Stefon Diggs.
story: Cardi B is officially a mom of four.
The 33-year-old rapper welcomed a baby boy with NFL star and boyfriend Stefon Diggs, Cardi's rep confirmed to TODAY.com on Nov. 13.
No additional information was shared at this time.

The news comes after she posted an Instagram video of herself strutting to her song “Hello.” In the caption, she wrote how her life has recently been a “combination of different chapters and different seasons.”
Now starting over and in a “new season,” she shared that it’s “never easy but it’s been so worth it,” before touching on motherhood.

“I brought new music and a new album to the world! A new baby into my world, and one more reason to be the best version of me, one more reason to love me more than anything else or anyone else so I can continue giving my babies the love and life they deserve,” she wrote in part.
Cardi revealed in a Sept. 17 CBS News interview that she was pregnant with her fourth child, and first with the New England Patriots wide receiver.

“I’m having a baby with my boyfriend, Stefon Diggs,” she told Gayle King. “I’m excited. I’m happy. I feel like I’m in a good space. I feel very strong, I feel very powerful that I’m doing all this work, but I’m doing all this work while I’m creating a baby.”
At the time, she said that her baby would be born ahead of her 2026 tour.
Cardi is also mother to three children with rapper Offset: daughter Kulture, son Wave and daughter Blossom born in 2024. She filed for divorce from Offset for a second time in 2024.
Diggs, meanwhile, is also father to a daughter from a previous relationship.
During an Oct. 6 episode of the “On Purpose with Jay Shetty” podcast, Cardi shared spoke about supporting her children and her worst parenting fear.

“Please don’t be lazy,” she told Jay Shetty. “Don’t be a bum ... please don’t be lazy... Some people have the look, the intelligence, the talent. Some people really have that. But they don’t go nowhere because they’re lazy. Don’t be lazy!”
She added that she would be willing to financially assist her kids into adulthood, but hopes they “become something.”

“Even when they’re 18 ... and it’s time to leave, if you want an apartment, if you want a car, I’ll give it to you, but please, please become something,” she said. “Please don’t be nothing. That would be the worst disappointment they could ever do. Don’t disappoint me like that.”

title: Former 'DWTS' Host Tom Bergeron Apologizes to Bobby Bones for Comments About His Season 27 Win
summary: Tom Bergeron's return to "Dancing With the Stars" this week caused major drama with Season 27 champion Bobby Bones
story: Tom Bergeron's return to "Dancing With the Stars" this week caused major drama with Season 27 champion Bobby Bones.

In a Nov. 12 Instagram video, Bones shared that it was "hurtful" hearing former host Bergeron's comments about his controversial win with pro Sharna Burgess in 2019 and also revealed that he returned his Mirrorball trophy to ABC.

Bergeron served as a guest judge on the dance competition’s Nov. 11 "20th Birthday Party" episode. During an interview with Parade ahead of the episode, he was asked to name the most surprising eliminations from his years as host.

"The thing that shocked me most was a win — Bobby Bones," he responded. "That was when I went, 'Uhh.' .... Bobby Bones was the first time ... it was like, 'Ouch.' No disrespect to Bobby. He would probably say the same thing."
Bones clapped back at Bergeron's snub in his video.

"This was hurtful and not because of what was said, but really who said it ... Am I supposed to not show up and work hard? Am I supposed to not give it freaking everything that I have? Am I supposed to throw it and not win?” he said.

"It’s crazy the amount of hate I get even from people that I respect like Tom Bergeron there and Julianne Hough ...I feel like a sixth-grader and all the 9th grade dancing kids are shoving me in lockers," Bones continued. (Hough appeared on "Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen" in August 2024 and agreed with fellow guest Mickey Guyton that Bones was the winner they "strongly disagreed with," E! News reported at the time. Hough also said Bones "was not the best dancer.")
The radio host said the many "random shots" he's received from DWTS personalities have "taken all the joy" out of his win.

“I had a great attitude, I worked hard and here we are six years later, I’m still catching strays out of nowhere," he said. "So I sent the trophy back. They don't want me to be a part of the show, obviously."
Bones did not clarify in the clip when he decided to return his Mirrorball trophy.
Following Bones' video, Bergeron apologized in a direct message, sharing a screenshot of it on his Instagram story.
“Bobby, it wasn’t my intention to hurt your feelings. My ‘ouch’ was based on my honest feeling that your win spoke to a need to address the balance between judge and viewer voting," Bergeron wrote.
He further explained, "I always felt bad that both you & Sharna had to deal with the aftermath of that win & I certainly regret pouring any salt into that old wound."
At the top of his screenshot, Bergeron wrote, "I was doing so many interviews leading up to the 20th, I was bound to say something inelegantly," and added a facepalming emoji.

Bones and Burgess won Season 27 in 2018, besting runners-up Milo Manheim and pro Witney Carson. When the competition show returned for Season 28, a new element was added that allowed the judges to save one of the bottom two couples every week.
Currently, the judges' scores are combined with the viewers' votes every week to determine who goes home.

title: Chili’s ‘Wicked’ Margaritas Are Apparently Wicked Strong
summary: Chili’s "Wicked" margaritas of the month are giving people wicked hangovers, according to multiple viral TikToks.
story: A pair of green and pink drinks are causing customers to defy gravity.

“Wicked: For Good,” is hitting theaters on Nov. 21 and, in the lead-up to Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) and Glinda (Ariana Grande) belting their way into our hearts once more, food brands and restaurants have released “Wicked” treats: churros, cereal, macaroni and so much more.
But no collab has intoxicated people quite like Chili’s “Wicked” Margaritas — literally.
All over TikTok, customers are sipping, slurping, gulping and, in some cases, double-fisting Chili’s movie-themed margaritas.

The Good Witch Marg is pink in Glinda’s aesthetic and made with blanco tequila, triple sec, dragon fruit syrup, sour mix and topped with soda water and a swizzle stick wand.The Witches Brew Marg is green like Elphaba and has blanco tequila, blue curacao, granny smith apple syrup, sour mix and garnished with a swizzle stick shaped like a broom with a witch’s hat on top.
The Good Witch Marg is pink in Glinda’s aesthetic and made with blanco tequila, triple sec, dragon fruit syrup, sour mix and topped with soda water and a swizzle stick wand.
The Witches Brew Marg is green like Elphaba and has blanco tequila, blue curacao, granny smith apple syrup, sour mix and garnished with a swizzle stick shaped like a broom with a witch’s hat on top.
Both margaritas cost $6 each. When cocktails these days can go for $20 or more these days, Chili’s drinks have become rather — wait for it — popular.
And so, it seems, people are overindulging on these potions.
“Why would they try to get you drunk off of a six dollar margarita immediately,” says TikToker @_yagirlj_. The on-screen caption asks, “why the Wicked margaritas so potent???? Omggg.”
Indeed, revelers are waking up post-Chili’s with a hangover so bad that just hearing Cynthia Erivo’s “Defying Gravity” vocal run could send them to the hospital.
No one, though, has quite become the face of this phenomenon quite like one 27-year-old in Utah, who first posted a viral review of the drinks, then the aftermath of his night.

“If you go to Chili’s to try the new ‘Wicked’ margaritas, don’t have seven of them,” Thorn says in a video with millions of views. He appears to have just woken up from a deep slumber, worse for the wear. “Just have two. Just try the green, try the pink and leave it at that. Take it from me, okay?”
He brings the phone closer to his face.
“The pink one was so good. Those are the best margaritas I’ve ever had in my life,” he emphasizes before groaning. “But I literally feel obliterated right now.”
“you got a Wicked hangover,” commented one user on TikTok.
“have you been changed....for good?” joked another.
One concerned soul said, “hi i bartend at chilis…SEVEN?” then added, “seven is just a LOT those ones are STRONG.”
George Felix, Chili’s chief marketing officer, says, “We’ve had a blast bringing a little magic to our Margarita of the Month lineup this fall."

“Our guests are pulling their phones out the second The Witches Brew and Good Witch Margs hit the table,” he adds, “and we’ve loved watching how guests are getting into the fun and sharing that over-the-top energy on social.”
For Thorn, who has been back to Chili’s for more margs since his big night, it’s been fun to see the excitement from everyone on social media.

“The last time I went to Chili’s, I had people come up and tell me they were there to try the drinks because of my videos which I thought was so special and truly a dream come true!” he tells TODAY.com.
“Chili’s, ‘Wicked’ and margaritas are my three favorite things. I will be going back as many times as I can before the drinks are gone!”

title: BravoCon 2025 Is Here! Here’s How You Can Watch All Weekend

story: BravoCon returns to Las Vegas Nov. 13-16 — but what happens in Vegas doesn’t always stay in Vegas thanks to Peacock, the event’s official streaming home.

Fans who couldn't score BravoCon tickets this year can still join in the fun by grabbing their remotes to watch all the star-studded panels, reunions and other must-see moments on Peacock. Read on to learn what BravoCon has in store for Bravoholics this weekend and how to tune into the Sin City action from the comfort of your home.
TODAY, Bravo and Peacock share the same parent company, NBCUniversal.

Want to do a little pre-gaming before the big event? Relive highlights from BravoCon 2023 now streaming on Peacock.

title: Why Kim Kardashian Said She Needed To Pass The Bar Exam 'on the 1st Try'
summary: On the latest episode of "The Kardashians," Kim Kardashian revealed how she feels about taking the bar exam and said she hopes to pass the test on the first try.
story: Kim Kardashian said she had no room for error when it came to the California bar exam.
In the latest episode of "The Kardashians," which was filmed three months before Kardashian took the bar exam and failed, she explained why she needed to pass the test on the first try.
The reality TV star said she spent about "nine hours a day" studying and was happy to wrap her Hulu show "All's Fair" so she could focus more on her studies.
“I’m really just excited to have ‘All’s Fair’ wrapped and behind me so that I can just dive right on into studying and make that my No. 1 focus," she said on Season 7, Episode 4, of the series.
In a confessional, Kardashian admitted that she was feeling "exhausted."
When a producer asked her if she was "nervous" about taking the bar, she responded, yes.

“Yeah! Absolutely. I’m not ready yet," she said. "You know, you feel like you don’t know anything and then it all clicks and then you feel like you don’t know it. It’s just the craziest, most emotional roller coaster."
"I really do need to pass on the first try," Kardashian added. "I don’t have another few months I can give up."

The State Bar of California released the results of its July 2025 exam on Nov. 7, announcing that 54.8% of exam takers passed. Just over 7,300 people took the test, 73.9% of which were first-time test takers. The pass rate for first-time takers was 69.7%, per the state bar.
Kardashian’s name was not included in the publicly available pass list.

She spoke about failing the bar in a TikTok video that she filmed while getting ready for her mother's 70th birthday party. Kardashian told someone on the phone that fortune tellers had inaccurately predicted her future.

“I’m just letting you guys know that all of the f--king psychics that we have met with and that we’re obsessed with are all f--king full of s--t," she said angrily. “They all collectively — maybe four of them have told me that I was going to pass the bar, so they’re all full pathological liars. Don't believe anything they say."
Last May, Kardashian completed her law program after six years of studying. Now that she's failed the bar, she'll have to re-take the test. The bar is given twice a year, in July and February.

title: How to Watch the 2025 Latin Grammys Tonight
summary: When are the 2025 Latin Grammys? Find out the day and time of the event, as well as the performers, nominations and how to watch and stream the awards ceremony.
story: The 2025 Latin Grammys will be one jam-packed show with the biggest names in Latin music in attendance.
Taking place tonight, Thursday, Nov. 13, the 26th annual Latin Grammy Awards return to Las Vegas after they were held in Miami last year.

The 2025 celebration will be a three-hour telecast filled with awards being handed out and performances by some of the most influential hitmakers, like Bad Bunny, who is up for 12 awards tonight. The show will celebrate Spanish singer Raphael, the 2025 Person of the Year, as well.
Actor Roselyn Sánchez returns as host, along with Colombian singer Maluma, who is making his hosting debut. This will be Sánchez's eighth time emceeing the event.

You will not want to miss all the excitement. The show will also feature a performance by Kacey Musgraves, who recently released a crossover collaboration with Carín León called “Lost in Translation.”
Read on to find out how to watch the 2025 Latin Grammy Awards, below.
What Day Are the 2025 Latin Grammys?
The 2025 Latin Grammy Awards will be held at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas on Thursday, Nov. 13.
What Time Do the 2025 Latin Grammys Start?
The awards show starts at 5 p.m. PT/8 p.m. ET.
Ahead of the ceremony, a one-hour pre-show will begin at 4 p.m. PT/7 p.m. ET, airing on Univision.
How to Watch and Stream the 2025 Latin Grammys
The Latin Grammys will air live on Univision and across TelevisaUnivision’s U.S platforms beginning at 8 p.m. ET/PT (7 p.m. Central).
Ahead of the televised show, the 2025 Latin Grammy Premiere ceremony will stream live across all Latin Recording Academy platforms, including YouTube, beginning at 12 p.m. PT/3 p.m. ET.
A majority of the awards, in categories and genres like rock, flamenco, hip-hop, electronic music and more, will be revealed during the 2025 Latin Grammy Premiere.
Who Is Performing?

There is a long list of performers who have joined the 2025 Latin Grammys lineup, including Bad Bunny, CA7RIEL & Paco Amoroso, Karol G, Jesús Ortiz Paz (Fuerza Regida), Chuwi, Fuerza Regida and Marco Antonio Solís.

They join previously announced performers Pepe Aguilar, Aitana, Rauw Alejandro, Edgar Barrera, Ivan Cornejo, DannyLux, Gloria Estefan, Joaquina, Kakalo, Carín León, Liniker, Morat, Christian Nodal, Los Tigres del Norte, Nathy Peluso, Elena Rose, Alejandro Sanz and Adelaido “Payo” Solís III (Grupo Frontera), as well as Grupo Frontera, Kacey Musgraves, Carlos Santana and the 2025 Person of the Year, Raphael.
Who Is Nominated?
There are over 50 categories included in the 2025 Latin Grammys. Bad Bunny leads the list of top nominees with 12. See a few of the general field categories, below.

title: Are 'Golden Bachelor' Stars Mel Owens and Peg Munson Still Together Now?
summary: Are Mel Owens and Peg Munson still together after the finale of The Golden Bachelor? Here's what happened to them after the show and if they're still dating.
story: The second season of “The Golden Bachelor” has come to an end, with lead Mel Owens kneeling on one knee and asking Peg Munson to accept...a promise ring.
Season 2 of “The Golden Bachelor” began with 23 women looking to find a soulmate in their golden years and hoping that it was Mel, a 66-year-old former NFL player who now works as a lawyer.

By the time the finale arrived on Wednesday, Nov. 12, only two women remained: Peg, a 62-year-old retired firefighter and bomb tech, and Cindy Angelcyk Cullers, a 60-year-old retired biomedical engineer.
Here's what happened in the finale and if Mel and his winner are still together now.
What happened in the 'Golden Bachelor' Season 2 finale?

The episode started with a shocker: Cindy decided to self-eliminate, realizing that Mel couldn't match her feelings. She had repeatedly expressed throughout the journey how much she had fallen for Mel.
After leaving, Cindy wept alone and said she thought Mel was her match. "I was so hopeful," she said. "It hurts really bad."
Mel, meanwhile, said that he was "shocked" by Cindy's departure. "I came into tonight thinking there was a future, but she quit," he said.
During the "After the Final Rose" event, Cindy said she didn't feel like she should have to "convince a man to love her," to applause from the audience.

Mel then spoke to Peg the next day and explained that he wasn't ready to "commit" to a proposal. That, she said, made her nervous, but she moved forward with meeting Mel's two sons and his college friend. The meeting went well, with consensus across the board that they were a good match.
Mel ultimately gave Peg a promise ring. "I trusted you. You trusted me. You told me you had confidence in me that I'd make the right choice — and here you are," he said, before showing a ring.
They committed to figuring out a future together.
Are Mel and Peg still together now?
Mel and Peg emerged at the "After the Final Rose" special all smiles. With a kiss, they confirmed they are, in fact, still together.
"It's exciting," Peg said. "We get to be out and we get to share this."
Peg said the connection "grew" after their time in Antigua, especially during the privacy of the Fantasy Suites.
"One thing I can say about Mel: He doesn't have integrity. He is integrity. Let that sink in. That's one thing I love about him," she said.
Mel said the relationship has progressed "very, very well" since the show ended. They both said they are in love with each other.
"It worked!" host Jesse Palmer said.
CORRECTION (11/13 at 1:25 p.m.): This article originally stated that Mel proposed to Peg. In fact, he gave her a promise ring.

title: Jewelry Designers React to Taylor Swift Wearing One of Their Necklaces: ‘Top 10 Life Moment’
summary: Jaclyn and Kevin Elbaum of Audry Rose react to Taylor Swift wearing two of their diamond pieces and share how it's impacted their business.
story: Small business owners Jaclyn and Kevin Elbaum are always tickled pink when someone wears one of their beautiful pieces of jewelry. But they were enchanted to see one of the world's biggest stars sporting not one, but two special items from their collection last week.
On Nov. 5, Taylor Swift was spotted wearing a stunning yellow gold diamond lock necklace and a diamond chain lariat during a date night with fiancé Travis Kelce in New York City.
Word quickly spread that the items came from the Elbaums’ brand, Audry Rose, which the couple founded in 2015.
“It felt like a top 10 life moment kind of thing,” Kevin Elbaum tells TODAY.com in a joint interview with his wife, calling the experience “surreal.”
The married couple first learned that Swift was a fan of their jewelry while they were sitting down to dinner with their family.

“One of my friends, she just saw it and she calls me and was like, ‘I think this is your necklace.’ And so I open up Instagram and I zoom in and I was like, ‘Oh my God, that is my necklace,’” Jaclyn Elbaum recalls.
The mother of two's animated reaction initially concerned her husband.
"I wasn’t sure if someone had died. I couldn’t figure it out because her reaction was so insane that my heart sank," Kevin Elbaum says.
He decided to film his wife's reaction and post it on Instagram. In the video, Jaclyn Elbaum holds back tears as she looks at the photo of Swift wearing the two necklaces.
The couple was especially touched by Swift's selections. The "Life of a Showgirl" singer wore two pieces from their collection that hold special meaning to their family.
Jaclyn Elbaum designed the Pave Diamond Lock Necklace around five years ago and says the piece is “really close to my heart.”
Every part of the necklace is handmade, including the chain, which is named after the couple’s daughter Sloan.
“She couldn’t have picked a more important piece to us,” Kevin Elbaum adds.
The lariat that Swift paired with the lock necklace also holds sentimental value: Jaclyn Elbaum designed it for her mother’s 70th birthday.
A Life-Changing Moment for a Small Business

The Elbaums are the latest small business owners to experience the "Taylor Swift effect," referring to the singer's cultural and economic influence. Other examples include the NFL's increase in female viewership after Swift started dating Kelce and jewelry designer Kindred Lubeck's explosion in social media followers after Kelce proposed with one of her rings.
Even in their wildest dreams, the Elbaums had never imagined something like this could happen to their small business.

"We don’t have a publicist or anything. We hadn’t tried to get it to her, so we really were completely blindsided that this could even happen. We assumed the only way it could happen was if you got it to her stylist or something,” Kevin Elbaum says.
Ever since the photo of Swift wearing their jewelry went viral, the Elbaums have noticed an uptick in traffic to their brand’s website and more people purchasing the $7,800 lock necklace.
They’ve since added a sterling silver version of the lock necklace that retails for $890.
The Elbaums say they're incredibly grateful for Swift's support of small businesses.
"We would have paid her to have the necklace. This is clearly a passion project for her to just sprinkle the Taylor aura around to businesses she likes, so it’s really special," Kevin Elbaum says.
Jaclyn Elbaum adds that Swift "clearly cares about the craft and how things are made."
After seeing the photo of Swift wearing items from their brand, the Elbaums emailed the singer's team to express their gratitude.
"I appreciate what she does to all small businesses, not just ours. It's really a special thing to see," Jaclyn Elbaum says.
A Launchpad for a 'New Phase'
The Elbaums started Audry Rose in 2015 shortly after Jaclyn Elbaum's grandmother, the brand's namesake, passed away.

"She started in the clothing industry and was entrepreneurial before that was really a thing for women. She was really ahead of her time and I always looked up to her. She was always a role model for me. Quality of things was always very important to her, so we wanted that to be infused into the brand," Jaclyn Elbaum says.
Before the launch of their brand, Kevin Elbaum specialized in customer acquisition while Jaclyn Elbaum worked in the fashion industry.
“I always really wanted to do something with her, and it was just getting her over her fear to jump with me,” Kevin Elbaum says.
The Elbaums say it'll be a long time before they're able to shake off the feeling of seeing Swift wearing one of their designs.
Looking ahead, the couple hopes this is simply the beginning of a new phase for their brand.

"I want everyone to know quality for us is really important and I hope other people trust our brand like she did," Jaclyn Elbaum says. "We’re just really excited to keep going, keep designing, keep growing."
This moment will certainly be hard to beat, but the Elbaums are excited to see what's next.
"We're just kind of trying to keep moving forward and hoping for some other special moment in the next 10 years," Kevin Elbaum says.

title: 'Palm Royale' Season 2 Premiere Reveals Robert's Fate
summary: Palm Royale is back for Season 2. Find out Robert's fate and what happened after he was shot in the Season 1 finale.
story: Warning: Spoiler alert for Season 2, Episode 1 of “Palm Royale.”
“Palm Royale” Season 1 ended with a bang and started with one as well.

The finale of the Apple TV+ show ended with Ricky Martin’s character, Robert, accidentally getting shot by Mary (Julia Duffy) after she attempted to assassinate President Nixon. The final scene showed Robert, who was pretending to be Astronaut Grant, bleeding on the floor.
With Season 2 of “Palm Royale” premiering Nov. 12, fans are curious to know: Is Robert dead?
“Well, we’re not saying he (dies),” creator Abe Sylvia previously told TODAY.com following the 2024 finale. “This is a classic soap opera cliffhanger.”
The showrunner also noted that if people looked closer, he was still breathing. But did Robert survive?

Season 2 begins with a major musical production. Maxine Dellacorte (Kristen Wiig) returns to the Palm Royale and orders a drink, but instead of her signature cocktail, a grasshopper, she gets served a martini.

When she asks the waiter where Robert is, he says he's getting ready for “his big number.” Confused, she enters the ballroom and to her surprise Robert, in a snazzy and bedazzled tuxedo, starts singing “Comin’ Home Baby,” complete with dancers and backup singers.

It becomes a whole production when Maxine, in a bright yellow two-piece ensemble, gets on the table and starts to perform her own dance routine. The performance, Sylvia tells TODAY, is the “musical number of my dreams.”

“We wanted to start with a bang. I’m such a huge fan of movie musicals. I started as a dancer myself, and so I brought a whole book full of inspirations to the designers and brought in the choreographer,” Sylvia says. “It’s a mash up of a lot of my personal influences, and I was just so grateful that everybody brought their A-game and that we were able to make the musical number of my dreams.”
Shot in one day from beginning to end in a single take, he says, the dancers rehearsed for about three days while the costumes took weeks. They also built the set from scratch.

However, as the performance continues, Robert is shot and begins to bleed. Maxine, still on top of the table, is dragged away from Robert as flashbacks of the Season 1 finale when he was shot appear on screen. The musical number continues and ends with Robert on the floor.
It turns out Maxine was hallucinating and admitted into mental institute Sunny Tides. They have drugged her and she keeps asking for Robert.
Robert is then seen unconscious in a hospital bed with Norma (Carol Burnett) by his side asking how he knew her name. Robert appears to be alive, for now.
As viewers recall, Robert discovered that Norma was really Agnes and stole her identity. This was after Norma asked Robert to marry her so that he could inherit all her wealth.
In the second season's first episode, Norma begins to put the pieces together.
But will Robert survive and be a threat to Norma?

In one scene, Maxine escapes Sunny Tides and visits Robert at the hospital. She hides underneath the hospital bed as Norma walks in and the doctor tells her that Robert is “touch and go,” leaning on go. If he does wake up, the doctor says, his speech will be their first sign of hope and from there they will assess for any brain damage.
After the doctor leaves, Norma talks to an unconscious Robert and tells him, “I know who told you about Agnes.”
By the end of the episode, Robert opens his eyes and simply says, “Agnes.”

“It’s so funny because I read the last episode last season and I’m like, ‘Oh, am I dying?’ and then Abe told me, ‘Oh, Ricky, I’m sorry I forgot to tell you, you’re not going to die,’” Martin tells TODAY.com. “But I am open to anything.”
Kristen Wiig adds that “it’s been hard to keep” Robert’s fate a secret, “because people have seen photos. So it’s been really hard for us to be like, ‘Is he a ghost?’”
But as viewers know, if anyone gets in Norma's way, their future could be up in the air.

Sylvia notes that this season he played with different genres, including the theme of ‘60s “bitty horror movies.” He cites “Whatever Happened to Baby Jane” and “Hush… Hush, Sweet Charlotte“ as inspiration.

“We wanted to bring an element of that to us. Even though the show is ostensibly a comedy, we want people on the edge of their seat and have this element of thriller to it,” he adds. “And as you make your way through the season, that just keeps building and building and building.”
As for Martin and Wiig, they joke that “a fake death every season” would be “funny.”
“You haven’t gotten to 10, so who knows what happens,” quips Wiig, with Martin adding, “You have to see Episode 10.”
New episodes of “Palm Royale” premiere weekly on Wednesdays on Apple TV+.

title: The Pope Shares His 4 Favorite Movies and They're All Tear-Jerkers
summary: Four classic movies can now add "pope-approved" to their accolades.
story: Four classic movies can now add "pope-approved" to their accolades.
In anticipation of a celebration at cinema at the Vatican, Pope Leo XIV shared his four favorite movies in a video released on Nov. 11 by Variety.
The Chicago native has yet to find a movie released this century to crack his top four, as his favorites span from the 1940s through the 1990s.

Pope Leo, who is the first pope from America, released the list ahead of a meeting at the Vatican on Oct. 15 in which he will greet Hollywood stars like Cate Blanchett, Adam Scott, Spike Lee and Chris Pine.

The pope "has expressed his desire to deepen dialogue with the World of Cinema … exploring the possibilities that artistic creativity offers to the mission of the Church and the promotion of human values,” the Vatican said in a statement, according to Variety.
His four favorite films are:

Frank Capra’s 1964 classic “It’s a Wonderful Life" Robert Wise’s iconic 1965 musical “The Sound of Music”Robert Redford’s 1980 Oscar-winning drama “Ordinary People" Roberto Benigni’s 1997 Oscar-winning comedy-drama “Life Is Beautiful," which Pope Leo announced by its Italian name, "La Vita è Bella."
Frank Capra’s 1964 classic “It’s a Wonderful Life"
Robert Wise’s iconic 1965 musical “The Sound of Music”
Robert Redford’s 1980 Oscar-winning drama “Ordinary People"
Roberto Benigni’s 1997 Oscar-winning comedy-drama “Life Is Beautiful," which Pope Leo announced by its Italian name, "La Vita è Bella."

"It's a Wonderful Life" is a holiday season staple starring Jimmy Stewart as George Bailey, who contemplates taking his own life on Christmas Eve before his guardian angel shows the impact he has made on others and what the world would be like if he was no longer in it.

"The Sound of Music" is one of the most legendary musicals of all time and winner of the Academy Award for best picture. The film version of the Broadway musical stars Julie Andrews as Maria, a governess to seven children in Austria who teaches them to sing and ultimately falls in love with their father and marries him. The family later must flee the Nazis to freedom in Switzerland.

The drama "Ordinary People" was Robert Redford's first feature film as a director and stars Donald Sutherland and television legend Mary Tyler Moore as married couple Calvin and Beth Jarrett. The two deal with the fallout from the accidental death of their teen son and the effect is has on their younger son, played by Timothy Hutton, and his relationship with both of them.
The film was the best picture winner at the Oscars, and Redford won best director and Hutton took home the best supporting actor trophy.

"Life Is Beautiful" stars Italian actor Roberto Benigni, who also directed the film. He plays a Jewish Italian bookstore owner who is able to find moments of joy for his son amid the horrors of a Nazi concentration camp. He pretends the camp is a game to shield the boy from the atrocities being committed and keeps his son alive long enough for the boy to be rescued by Allied soldiers.
Benigni became the first to win the Academy Award for best actor for a performance that was not in English.

title: ‘Devil Wears Prada 2’ Teaser Trailer Has Meryl Streep and Anne Hathaway Back Together Again
summary: Fans of "The Devil Wears Prada" are finally getting an official peak at the movie's long awaited sequel
story: Fans of "The Devil Wears Prada" are finally getting an official peak at the movie's long awaited sequel.

On Nov. 12, 20th Century Studios released a teaser trailer for "The Devil Wears Prada 2," appropriately set to Madonna's 1990 dance hit "Vogue." The 50-second teaser shows fashion editor Miranda Priestly, played by Meryl Streep, wearing her signature shades as she struts down the hall of Runway magazine in studded red stilettos.
Miranda steps into an elevator alone. But as she waits for the doors to close, a hand presses between the doors to stop them.
That's when Andy Sachs, Miranda's former assistant played by Anne Hathaway, steps in beside Miranda and looking equally as glam.
“Took you long enough,” Miranda tells Andy, who lets a smile pass through her lips as she puts on her own pair of dark sunglasses.

Hathaway also shared the trailer on her official Instagram, captioning it, “It’s everyone’s birthday,” and adding several emoji and the hashtags #43 #DWP2. (The actor celebrated her 43rd birthday Nov. 12.)
The highly anticipated sequel will follow Miranda, one of fashion's biggest influencers, as she navigates her career in a world where print journalism is on the wane, according to IMDb.

The sequel to the 2006 film also reunites Streep and Hathaway with Emily Blunt, who reprises her character, Emily Charlton, another former assistant of Miranda's. Emily's now a powerful executive for a luxury group that's rolling in all the advertising dollars Priestly needs for Runaway.

Stanley Tucci, Tracie Thoms and Tibor Feldman are also reprising their roles for “The Devil Wears Prada 2.” They'll be joined by several stars new to the franchise, including Kenneth Branagh, who plays Miranda's husband; Patrick Brammall, who plays Andy's love interest; Rachel Bloom, Lucy Liu, B.J. Novak, Justin Theroux, imone Ashley and Pauline Chalamet, Variety reports.
"The Devil Wears Prada 2" is set for a May 1, 2026, release date.

title: 'Mormon Wives' Star Jen Affleck Says She 'Manifested' Co-Star Taylor Frankie Paul's Role as New 'Bachelorette'
summary: Jen Affleck and Jessi Ngatikaura react to their Mormon Wives co star Taylor Frankie Paul being cast as the new Bachelorette.
story: When news broke that Taylor Frankie Paul would be the next star of "The Bachelorette," some were surprised to see the dating series name a newcomer as lead of the show for the first time. But Paul's "Secret Lives of Mormon Wives“ co-star Jen Affleck wasn't one of them.

"I’ve been saying this for a minute now. In fact, I literally mentioned this to Taylor, I want to say even like last year. I was like, 'What if you were the next Bachelorette?'" Affleck tells TODAY.com during a recent video call.

Affleck, who has had a front row seat to Paul's complicated relationship history in recent years, says she's always thought her co-star would bring a fresh perspective to "The Bachelorette," which has been airing since 2003.
"Especially because I feel like 'The Bachelor' and 'Bachelorette' have been slowly dying, like the franchise itself has been dying," Affleck says.
The reality star put her producer cap on and imagined what a reimagined "Bachelorette" could look like if her friend was the star.
"I was like, 'If Taylor went on there, I think she would save the franchise, and that’s exactly what happened. I think I manifested it for her," Affleck says.
Affleck and Paul's co-star Jessi Ngatikaura says the entire #MomTok team is "so excited" for Paul to embark on her "Bachelorette" journey.
“She’s going to bring such a unique twist to the show. It’s going to be like Taylor’s version of ‘The Bachelorette,’ and we’re so excited to watch her and cheer her on," she says.
Typically, "Bachelorette" leads are chosen from a prior season of "The Bachelor." Paul's casting marks a first for the ABC show.
Before Paul began filming the dating series, Ngatikaura had the opportunity to bestow some advice on her friend.

"I was kind of on the journey with her leading up to her leaving. She hadn’t really watched the show, and I grew up watching it. So I feel like I gave her a lot of advice just from being a viewer on what to expect," she says.
Paul's on-and-off relationship with Dakota Mortensen has been a focal point in the first two seasons of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives,” which returns for Season 3 on Nov. 13.
After calling it quits with Mortensen, Paul was ready to move on when she began filming "The Bachelorette," Ngatikaura says.

"She went into it just excited to have a fresh start and to just see that there are other options out there besides Dakota. I think she needed to get out of that bubble and just open up her world, so I’m excited to see what happens."
Paul, who was previously married to Tate Paul, went public with her relationship with Mortensen in 2022 amid a soft swinging scandal that rocked the #MomTok community.
In a TikTok Live video, Paul admitted that she and her ex-husband had engaged in soft swinging with other members of the group. The show's other cast members denied the allegations.
Paul later introduced her followers to Mortensen as the man she “cheated with” during the soft swinging scandal. The couple's son, Ever, was born in 2024.
Throughout their relationship, Paul and Mortensen navigated cheating rumors and what some members of Paul's family described as a volatile communication style.
In the Season 2 reunion special, Paul said she and Mortensen had broken up and were working on themselves.

title: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo On How Glinda and Elphaba Appear ‘Very Different’ In ‘Wicked: For Good’
summary: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo tell TODAY how their "Wicked: For Good" characters seem different, but actually have a lot in common.
story: Moviegoers are getting set to return to Oz with the highly anticipated release of “Wicked: For Good,” which revisits the complex relationship between Ariana Grande’s Glinda and Cynthia Erivo’s Elphaba first chronicled in last year’s blockbuster “Wicked.”
The pair, who were each nominated for Academy Awards for their work in “Wicked,” says their characters continue to evolve, while dealing with similar issues.

“I think both Glinda and Elphaba are both experiencing this extreme loneliness and they appear very different,” Grande told TODAY’s Sheinelle Jones in an interview alongside Erivo that aired Nov. 12. “Elphaba is literally isolated. And Glinda has so many people saying that they love her and saying that they need her and yet she’s completely alone.”
Grande said she wanted to see her character grow.
“For me, it was kind of making sure that person who’s inside the bubble that we eventually get to pop is underneath the surface,” she said.

“Wicked” has captured the imaginations of moviegoers around the world. The sequel continues to document the relationship between Glinda and Elphaba, a dynamic that Erivo says hits home for so many people.
“I think the central narrative, which is that friendship between the two women, between us. I think it’s the notion that feeling or being different isn’t a bad thing,” she said.
Erivo also marveled at Grande at work.
“It was very wonderful to watch, to see the passion for the depth of who this character was or the layers that’s sort of shown up,” she said.
Grande and Erivo established a close connection making the “Wicked” films. It’s a career moment that Grande cherishes.

“To be able to act with this one and to share a space and to be a scene partner with you was the greatest privilege of my professional life,” she said of Erivo. “Let alone sing with her, the greatest singer in the entire world. I’m spoiled for life.”
“Wicked: For Good” comes out Nov. 21.

title: Ariana Grande Says This 'Wicked' Memory with Cynthia Erivo Was the 'Best Moment Of My Life'
summary: Ariana Grande told Sheinelle Jones the "best moment of her life" was a moment she had filming "Wicked" with Cynthia Erivo.
story: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande say working on "Wicked: For Good" changed them — for good.
During a Nov. 12 appearance on TODAY, the duo recalled what it was like to act alongside one another in the second movie edition of the beloved Broadway show.

"To be able to act with this one and to share a space and to be a scene partner with you was the greatest privilege of my professional life. Let alone sing with her, the greatest singer in the entire world. I’m spoiled for life," Grande said, which made Erivo emotional.
"Thank you. I love you," she replied.
When asked how they built such a strong friendship on set, Erivo said she believes that she and Grande are "like opposite sides of the same coin."
“So I think we each have something the other can love and can see themselves ... It’s super just honest with each other,” she added.
When Sheinelle asked the duo for a behind-the-scenes moment that still stands out, Grande remembered when Erivo cheered on her vocal performance

“I’ll never forget when you yelled ‘work’ ... she liked something that acted vocally, so when she was singing, she yelled, ‘Work.’ And I was like, this is the best day of my life,” Grande said. “It was really funny. That was a good one.”
Erivo recalled that day as well and said she has a tendency to congratulate others in the moment.
“I don’t know how to contain it. If I hear something that I really like, if she does something that I really like very clearly, I verbally have to express myself,” she said.
“It was the best moment of my life,” Grande added.
“Wicked: For Good” will hit theaters on Nov. 21.

Grande and Erivo attended the Nov. 10 "Wicked" premiere in London wearing matching dark dresses. Grande opted for a black tulle ballgown designed by Gilbert Adrian in 1995 and Erivo donned a stunning deep blue and black Prada dress. On the red carpet, they were photographed holding hands.

title: 'Married at First Sight' Star Jalyn Confronts Josh with Her 1 'Worry' About Him: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Josh and Jalyn from Married at First Sight Season 19 have a tense discussion about Burning Man.
story: As decision day inches closer, one "Married at First Sight" couple has a heart to heart about the future of their relationship in the latest episode of the Peacock series, and TODAY.com has a first look.

In the Season 19 premiere, viewers saw Josh, a 31-year-old contractor, marry Jalyn, a 27-year-old realtor. It didn't take long for the newlyweds to connect on a physical and emotional level, and they quickly strengthened their bond.

As the experiment continued, Jalyn and Josh began to experience a few hiccups, including differing opinions on whether they should still follow their exes on social media. Above all, Josh's love for music festivals, particularly Burning Man, was a sticking point for the couple.

When Josh learned that Jalyn didn't share his passion for music festivals and wasn't thrilled by the idea of going to Burning Man, he worried that he wouldn't be able to experience the sense of community he has always found at the festival.
In TODAY's first look clip of the latest episode, which premieres on Nov. 13, Josh and Jalyn go out to dinner and discuss the state of their relationship.

"Jalyn and I have had some really important conversations recently. We're definitely still learning how our lives would mesh together, but I want to build this life I always dreamed of having with Jalyn. And so with decision day coming up, I'm hoping she feels the same way," Josh says in a confessional interview.
At dinner, Jalyn starts the conversation and explains how she's concerned that Josh won't be happy if she doesn't go to Burning Man.

"When I bring up conversations about, 'OK, how can we get everything you love from Burning Man into everyday life?' It's not because I'm trying to be like, 'How can we move it all over here so you can stop going over there?' It's not that way," she says. "I really care about you and I want you to be really happy."
Jalyn goes on to say she's concerned that Josh could easily date someone who shared his passions and would fulfill that part of him more than she can.

"I think that that's where I get tripped up because it's like, I don't want to feel like I'm just changing your life and making you feel like you have to give up things you (want) to do and you can go find that with somebody else. That's where I stress out," she says, calling it her "worry" about their relationship.
Josh reassures his wife and says that he can see where she's coming from.

"At the end of the day, music is a really big part of what I enjoy  but it's not who I am. If I really think about it, there's a lot of things about me that make me who I am way outside of that," he says.
Jalyn then suggests that her husband could still attend the Burning Man festival this year then they could take a couple's trip and go on a retreat or something similar.

"I'll be completely honest with you, babe. I've literally already thought of myself at Burning Man without you and I already feel like it's not gonna be the same," he said, adding that he doesn't see himself going without her.
In a confessional interview, Jalyn then explains her position further.

"I think Josh is really good at making me feel reassured but these are things that could potentially be easier said than done. You know, I could see myself spending forever with him. I think my biggest fear is he's just telling me what I want to hear so I just say yes by the end of this," she says.
Back at dinner, Jalyn applauds her husband and says she wants him to be happy.
"No matter what happens on decision day, I want you to know I think that you're such an incredible person and I think you're deserving of everything you want," she says.

At the end of the eight-week experiment, Jalyn and Josh will need to decide if they want to stay married or go their separate ways. They are one of five couples who got married at first sight this season, including Jalyn's mother, Belynda, a 47-year-old esthetic consultant who tied the knot with Chad, a 54-year-old real estate executive .

title: Taps run dry as water crisis forces Iran to consider evacuating its capital
summary: Iran is facing its worst water crisis in decades, with authorities warning they may even have to evacuate Tehran amid a drought, climate change and mismanagement.
story: TEHRAN, Iran — A drastic new message adorns the walls of the Iranian capital, usually reserved for war heroes and weapons.
“There is a water shortage!” reads the government poster's slogan, inside a water container that is nearly empty. “It’s fall and there is still no rain.”
That’s not news to Erfan Ensani, 39, who returned home from a long day working in the textile section of the city’s central bazaar last week to find his taps running dry.

Iran is facing its worst water crisis in decades. With no end in sight and authorities warning they may even have to evacuate the capital of 10 million people, residents like Ensani are scrambling to respond.

“We didn’t have water for three days. The pressure was so low that nothing came out,” Ensani, who, like many residents, works two jobs to make ends meet, told NBC News in a recent interview in Tehran.
“The water company says we should buy pumps to solve the problem and also get a storage tank to keep some water. But that’s expensive, especially now when the economy is bad,” Ensani said.

title: Heavy rain floods camps in Gaza, worsening conditions for displaced Palestinians
summary: Rain hammered the sprawling encampments across Gaza on Saturday, turning roads into rivers, soaking freezing families inside their tents and forcing people to sweep dirty water from their shelters as it pooled around their beds and belongings
story: Rain hammered the sprawling encampments across Gaza on Saturday, turning roads into rivers, soaking freezing families inside their tents and forcing people to sweep dirty water from their shelters as it pooled around their beds and belongings.

The storms arrived as cold weather set in, adding new urgency to humanitarian concerns for the strip’s 2 million residents, and as tensions flare up in Israel within Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Cabinet.
Sana Abu Harad, 38, cried out as she pointed to her shivering child and the drenched set of beds on the wet and muddied floor inside her tent in a Gaza City camp.

“Everything is underwater,” she told NBC News. “Why must this little child sleep in floodwater? I struggled so much just to get this tent, and now nothing protects us. Where will I live with my children now?”

The crisis has been compounded by the collapse of water and sewage systems after two years of Israeli strikes destroyed key infrastructure, leaving hundreds of thousands of people crowded into areas with almost no toilets, drainage or sanitation.

In Gaza, where an estimated 90% of the population has been displaced, more than 1.5 million people “urgently require emergency shelter assistance,” the United Nations’ migration agency IOM said last month.
Mahmoud Basal, a spokesman for Gaza’s Civil Defense agency, said Saturday that the enclave was facing a “true catastrophe” due to the heavy rains.

“The mixing of rainwater with sewage has caused an environmental disaster and will lead to health catastrophes,” he told NBC News. “There is no sewage system, no rainwater drainage system, and no water reservoirs; all of them have been destroyed by Israel, along with all the infrastructure.”

The U.N. said last week that Israel has rejected over 100 requests for the entry of relief materials, including “blankets, winter clothes, and tools and material to maintain and operate water, sanitation and hygiene services.”
Such restrictions continue to hamper humanitarian efforts, deputy U.N. spokesperson Farhan Haq told journalists in New York.

COGAT, the Israeli body in charge of humanitarian aid in Gaza, said on X last week that “hundreds of trucks carrying food, water, fuel, gas, medicines, medical equipment, tents, and shelter supplies enter the Gaza Strip every day.”

The U.N. Security Council is expected to vote Monday on a U.S. proposal for a U.N. mandate for an international stabilization force in Gaza, which has faced pushback from Russia, China and some Arab countries.

Tensions have flared up in Israel over a joint statement in support of the resolution, organized by the U.S., which said the ongoing peace process “offers a pathway to Palestinian self-determination and statehood.”

The reference to Palestinian statehood has incensed two far-right members of the Israeli Cabinet, National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir and Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, who on Saturday pressed Netanyahu to disavow it.

In a post on X, Ben-Gvir called on him to clarify that Israel “will not allow the establishment of a Palestinian state in any form,” while Smotrich said in an X post that Netanyahu must “make it clear to the entire world” no such state would ever exist.
Netanyahu is reliant on continued support from ultranationalists to maintain his majority.
The prime minister said at a government meeting on Sunday that Israel’s opposition to a “Palestinian state in any territory has not changed.”
“I don’t need reinforcements and tweets and lectures from anyone,” he added.

The deployment of an international security force inside the enclave has proved a major obstacle in advancing negotiations for the next phase of the ceasefire, as well as Hamas’ disarmament, the future governance of Gaza, and the remains of three Israeli hostages that have yet to be returned from Gaza.
With Gaza’s infrastructure still in ruin and storms battering its makeshift camps, those living there can only hope for future conditions to improve.
Ma’in Albuhteiti, 50, sleeps inside his Gaza City tent with seven of his children, but was awoken at 3 a.m. as rain swept over his family.
“Look at the bedding, the furniture, and the state of things,” he said. “We were completely flooded, we couldn’t move.”
“If there were proper shelter for us, we would go, we cannot manage,” he continued. “The situation is extremely tragic, and all the rain is pouring on us.”

title: The AI-powered flying bomb aimed at beating back Putin's legion of cheap drones
summary: Drone warfare as seen in Russia's war in Ukraine is sparking alarm in NATO and Europe that its forces are unprepared to fight unmanned aerial vehicles.
story: RIGA, Latvia — In a nondescript factory on the edge of Latvia’s capital, a small team is trying to solve a continental-sized problem: How can Europe protect itself from swarms of Russian attack drones?

Used on an almost nightly basis in the war in Ukraine, a spate of mysterious drone incursions above airports and sensitive sites has also highlighted Europe’s vulnerability to unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and sparked alarm that NATO nations are unprepared to defend themselves from the cheap but effective weaponry.

As a result, European leaders have backed plans for a “drone wall,” a network of sensors and weapons to detect, track and neutralize intruding UAVs, and in Riga, the team at a small tech company called Origin is on the forefront of this new, high-tech battleground.

Its solution, a 3-foot-tall interceptor drone named “Blaze.” Powered by an artificial intelligence system, it has been trained to recognize a hostile target and navigate close to it. It will then alert a human operator, who will make a decision on whether to intercept and push a button which explodes a 28-ounce warhead, self-destructing the drone and hopefully bringing down its target too.

“We don’t fly these systems. These systems fly themselves,” Origin  CEO Agris Kipurs told NBC News last week in an interview outside the factory, adding that Blaze addressed “the problem of relatively cheap, low-flying threats that are deployed in volumes.”
Kipurs, who previously developed drones to follow and film extreme sports athletes, said he pivoted to focus on defense technology after Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022.

The Ukrainian government estimates Russia is now making more than 300 drones a day at the cost of just a few thousand dollars — each enough to pound the capital, Kyiv, and other cities with massive aerial attacks every night.

Ukraine has also turned to relatively cheap drone technologies in a bid to offset Russia numerical advantages on the battlefield; last year, it became the first country to establish a separate branch of the military dedicated to drones.

title: Iran showcases ambition and advances at military museum after setbacks of Israel war
summary: NBC News was given exclusive access to The National Aerospace Park in Tehran as Iran, Israel and the U.S. could be heading for another war.
story: TEHRAN, Iran — Welcome to the missile museum.

That’s what locals call the vast exhibition space that reopened this week on the outskirts of the Iranian capital, Tehran. But make no mistake, the facility is a live demonstration of the Islamic Republic’s resolve to project growing strength after a chastening year of attacks by Israel and the United States.

The National Aerospace Park, as it’s more formally known, allows citizens a close-up look at the hardware that the country’s most powerful military force, the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, takes most pride in: missiles and drones.
An NBC News film crew was given exclusive access to the facility on Wednesday, a rarity for a foreign news organization.
